brief_summary.textblock:
Suicide is a significant cause of death in Korea. According to the report compiled by the
      Korea National Statistical Office, 24.8 victims of every 100,000 in 2007 (Korea National
      Statistical Office, 2008), which is higher compared with 10.1 in the United States, 6.0 in
      the United Kingdom, and 19.1 in Japan (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and
      Development, 2008). Especially, suicide rate is incredibly higher in elderly. Most persons
      who commit suicide have a diagnosed psychiatric disorder. Among them, 60% had Depression
      when they committed suicide. Therefore, this study aimed the impact of a care management
      intervention on depression treatment and reducing suicidal ideation in elderly patients with
      depression.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Long Term Effect of Collaborative Care on Depression Treatment in a Community Dwelling Elderly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  60 and older

          -  current major or minor depression

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe cognitive dysfunction

          -  severe auditory dysfunction

          -  history of psychosis

oversight_info.authority: Korea: Ministry for Health, Welfare and Family Affairs

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
